section.title: Terminology and notation
section.p: We will make the following two definitions relative to the standard inner products on \R^n and \C^n simultaneously. So, when interpreting the definitions for the real case, take V = \R^n and \inprod{\blank}{\blank} to mean the dot product. And when interpreting the definitions for the complex case, take V = \C^n and \inprod{\blank}{\blank} to mean the complex dot product.
